Class ServerController

java.lang.Object
Server.ServerController
public class ServerController extends Object
JavaFX controller for the server window (FXML).

Responsibilities:

  • Start/stop the BistroServer (OCSF server) on the default port.
  • Display server status (IP:port) and enable/disable UI buttons accordingly.
  • Maintain the connected-clients table using ClientConnectionRow.
  • Append runtime logs to the UI log area in a thread-safe way.

Threading:

  • BistroServer callbacks may arrive from a non-JavaFX thread.
  • All UI updates are wrapped with Platform.runLater(Runnable).

  • Constructor Details

    • ServerController

      public ServerController()

  • Method Details

    • onServerStarted

      public void onServerStarted(int port)
      Callback invoked when the server has started listening.
      Parameters:
      port - the port the server is listening on

    • onServerStopped

      public void onServerStopped()
      Callback invoked when the server has stopped. Clears the clients table to reflect that there are no active connections.

    • onClientConnected

      public void onClientConnected(String hostName, String ipAddress)
      Adds a new "connected" row to the clients table for a newly connected client.
      Parameters:
      hostName - client machine host name
      ipAddress - client IP address

    • onClientDisconnected

      public void onClientDisconnected(String hostName, String ipAddress)
      Marks an existing client row as "disconnected". If the matching row is not found, the table is still refreshed as a safe fallback.
      Parameters:
      hostName - client machine host name
      ipAddress - client IP address

    • appendLogFromServer

      public void appendLogFromServer(String msg)
      Appends a log message to the UI log area in a thread-safe manner. If logArea is not available (should not happen in normal UI), prints to stdout.
      Parameters:
      msg - log message to append
